violations.title: Violations
violations.subtitle: Anti-abuse system and violation management
violations.tooltip: The anti-abuse system analyzes user connections and detects anomalies: suspicious geo-movements, multiple ASNs, unusual devices and other deviations. Score from 0 to 100 shows the degree of suspicion.

severityTooltips.critical: Score 80–100. Serious anomalies requiring immediate intervention.
severityTooltips.low: Score 0–39. Informational notices, no action needed.

stats.totalTooltip: Total number of recorded violations for the selected period.
stats.uniqueUsersTooltip: Number of unique users with violations for the selected period. One user may have multiple violations.
stats.avgScoreTooltip: Average violation score (0–100). Calculated based on temporal, geolocation, ASN, profile and device anomalies.
stats.maxScoreTooltip: Highest recorded violation score for the selected period. Higher score means more anomalies detected.

violations.noRecords: No violation records for the selected period

triggerTypes.scheduleDesc: Runs periodically by CRON or interval
triggerTypes.thresholdDesc: Monitors a metric and triggers when threshold is reached

events.violation_detectedDesc: Triggers when a violation is detected (sharing, suspicious activity)
events.node_went_offlineDesc: Triggers when a node loses connection and becomes unavailable
events.user_traffic_exceededDesc: Triggers when a user exhausts their traffic limit

metrics.users_onlineDesc: Current number of active connections across all nodes
metrics.traffic_todayDesc: Total traffic volume for today (in gigabytes)
metrics.node_uptime_percentDesc: Node availability percentage over the last 24 hours
metrics.user_traffic_percentDesc: Percentage of traffic used from the limit

actionTypes.disable_userDesc: Deactivates the account, connections will be dropped
actionTypes.block_userDesc: Blocks the user with a specified reason
actionTypes.notifyDesc: Sends a message to Telegram or Webhook URL
actionTypes.restart_nodeDesc: Sends a restart command to the node
actionTypes.reset_trafficDesc: Resets user traffic counters to zero

actionDescs.notify: Sends notification to Telegram or Webhook

cronBuilder.hourlyDesc: At a specific minute of each hour
cronBuilder.dailyDesc: At a specific time every day
cronBuilder.weeklyDesc: On a specific day and time
cronBuilder.monthlyDesc: On a specific date and time

intervalPicker.intervalHint: Rule will run repeatedly at the selected time interval

constructor.newSubtitle: Create a rule that will automatically perform actions when certain events occur
constructor.triggerHint: Define the trigger condition. The rule will fire automatically when the selected event occurs.
constructor.eventHint: Event trigger responds to specific real-time system actions. The rule fires immediately after the event occurs.
constructor.minScoreHint: Severity filter. Rule will only fire if the violation score is at least this value. Leave empty to react to any violations.
constructor.minOfflineHint: Delay before triggering. Rule fires only if the node is down longer than the specified time. Helps avoid false positives from brief outages.
constructor.scheduleHint: Rule will run periodically on schedule. Use CRON for precise scheduling or a simple interval for repeating tasks.
constructor.thresholdHint: Threshold trigger monitors a numeric metric and fires when the value reaches the set threshold. Checked periodically.
constructor.metricConditionHint: Rule will fire when metric "{{metric}}" matches the condition
constructor.categoryHint: Category helps group rules for easy search and filtering.
constructor.categoryAutoHint: Suggested automatically, but you can change it.
constructor.conditionsHint: Optional step. Add conditions for more precise filtering. Rule fires only if ALL specified conditions are met simultaneously (AND logic). Without conditions, the rule fires on every trigger event.
constructor.noConditionsHint: Click "Add condition" to fine-tune or "Next" to continue without filters
constructor.actionHint: Choose the action the system will perform automatically when the trigger and conditions are met.
constructor.notifyHint: Specify where and what message to send when the rule fires
constructor.webhookHint: Data will be sent as a POST request in JSON format
constructor.blockReasonHint: This reason will be recorded in the user's profile and visible to admins. If not specified, the default reason will be used.
constructor.targetAutomatic: Target user is determined automatically from the trigger
constructor.blockScheduleWarn: Blocking by schedule requires an event or threshold trigger to determine the user
constructor.blockWarning: Warning: blocked user will lose access to the service
constructor.disableUserHint: User account will be deactivated. User won't be able to connect, but their data will be preserved. Account can be re-enabled manually.
constructor.disableScheduleWarn: For schedules, use "Cleanup expired" — disabling a specific user requires an event or threshold trigger
constructor.cleanupHint: Users whose subscription expired more than the specified number of days ago will be disabled. This helps automatically free up resources.
constructor.restartNodeHint: A restart command will be sent. Active connections will be temporarily interrupted.
constructor.restartSelectedWarn: Brief connection interruption on the selected node
constructor.restartAllWarn: Brief connection interruption for all users
constructor.resetTrafficHint: Traffic counters will be reset to zero. This will restore users' full traffic allowance per their plan.
constructor.resetTrafficScheduleWarn: Resetting traffic by schedule requires an event or threshold trigger to determine the user
constructor.forceSyncHint: Configuration on all nodes will be force-updated. Useful after bulk settings changes to ensure configuration is up to date on all servers.
constructor.ruleNameHint: Short name to identify the rule in the list
constructor.descriptionHint: Detailed description so other admins understand the rule's purpose
constructor.descriptionPlaceholder: Briefly describe the purpose of this rule
constructor.targetFromTrigger: Target: from trigger or all nodes
constructor.validationCron: Select a schedule or enter a CRON expression
constructor.validationConditions: Fill in all condition fields or remove incomplete ones

testResult.title: Test result
testResult.wouldTriggerDesc: Under current conditions, the rule would be activated
testResult.wouldNotTriggerDesc: Current conditions do not match the trigger settings

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Bot and panel configuration. Priority: DB > .env > default
settings.noSettingsHint: Make sure the database is connected and the bot has been started at least once

password.title: Change Password
password.generatedHint: You are using an auto-generated password. It is recommended to change it to your own.
password.generatedWarning: Save the password! It won't be shown again.

ipWhitelist.description: If the list is empty, access is allowed from any IP. When IPs are added, access will be limited to the specified addresses only. CIDR notation is supported (e.g., 10.0.0.0/8).

sync_interval_seconds.label: Sync interval
sync_interval_seconds.description: Data sync interval with API (seconds, requires restart)

reports_weekly_day.label: Weekly report day
reports_weekly_day.description: Day of week for weekly report (0=Mon, 6=Sun)

reports_monthly_day.label: Monthly report day
reports_monthly_day.description: Day of month for monthly report (1-28)

reports_min_score.label: Minimum score
reports_min_score.description: Minimum violation score to include in report

reports_top_violators_count.label: Top violators
reports_top_violators_count.description: Number of users in top violators list

reports_send_empty.label: Send empty reports
reports_send_empty.description: Send report when there are no violations for the period

reports_topic_id.label: Reports topic
reports_topic_id.description: Topic ID for sending reports (0 = main chat)

panel_name.label: Panel name
panel_name.description: Project name displayed in the sidebar (next to the logo)

legend.title: Value priority
legend.hint: Settings are applied instantly after changes.
legend.applyNote: Settings are applied instantly after changes. To reset, hover over a setting and click X.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.subtitle: Notification center, alert rules and delivery channels

alerts.deleteConfirmDesc: This alert rule will be permanently deleted.
alerts.name: Name
alerts.channelsHint: Select which channels to notify when this rule triggers. Channels must be configured in the Channels tab.

channels.title: Delivery Channels
channels.noChannelsHint: Add Telegram, Webhook or Email channel to receive notifications outside the panel
channels.webhookHint: Supports Discord, Slack and generic JSON webhooks
channels.emailHint: Requires SMTP to be configured by admin

mailServer.title: Mail Server
mailServer.subtitle: Embedded mail server — send and receive emails from your domain
mailServer.noDomains: No domains configured. Add a domain to start sending emails.
mailServer.deleteDomainConfirm: This will permanently delete this domain and its DKIM keys. Continue?
mailServer.ptrHint: PTR record must be configured at your VPS/hosting provider, not in the domain DNS panel
mailServer.deleteMessageConfirm: This will permanently delete this message. Continue?
mailServer.subject: Subject
mailServer.senderNameHint: Displayed in the 'From' field instead of email address

credentials.title: SMTP Credentials
credentials.subtitle: Manage logins for sending emails via SMTP Submission (port 587)
credentials.noCredentials: No SMTP credentials configured. Create one to allow external services to send emails.
credentials.allowedDomainsHint: Comma-separated. If empty, any configured domain is allowed.
credentials.deleteConfirm: This credential will be permanently deleted. External services will lose access. Continue?
